name: Marriott London Park Lane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very expensive for such small room and i experienced an air conditon problems. thus, i was moved to another room.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Love going to the Marriott on Park Lane. Has it all. Food, service and ambience. Not to mention the superb location right in the heart of it all. Regular visitor to London on business and always stay here. Thumbs up.
reviews.title: Thumbs up from regular visitor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel with a great location, have stayed here twice and both times perfect for a weekend in London
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great place to stay in London. Have stayed in other Marriott's in town and would rank the Park Lane right up there in terms of quality, location and service. Service is right up at the top with an especially helpful concierge. Executive lounge is pretty well equipped with quality foods and drinks throughout the day. One complaint is the 'squatting' in the lounge with internet users. Like the location as well being right across from Hyde Park and with plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. Overall a very good stay and a luxurious bed!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at this fine hotel. We arrived in the late morning from the USA. Our room was not ready, but they graciously allowed us to wait in a very nice lounge. Our room was large, comfortable and had a perfect view of Hyde Park. We enjoyed the immediate area, including the park and an excellent Thai restaurant located in the hotel's basement. The staff was outstanding and incredibly helpful. Like everything in London, the hotel was quite expensive. That said, we would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location for shopping or just doing the touristy thing. The park is just across the street if you like to plod the track to keep fit (whilst inhaling the exhaust gases of thousands of cars, taxis, buses and trucks).
reviews.title: Nickel and Dimes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The general appearance of the hotel, lobby, bar, restaurant, meeting rooms and guest rooms is very good indeed. It’s clean and does not show the signs of scuffing or general wear and tear. You feel good about staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: However, and this for me is a big “However”, the cheap-skate, Nickle and Diming attitude towards guest is, quite frankly, beneath such an establishment.
reviews.title: They could have a better internet connection for such money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was paying £225 (€255 / $360) a night Bed & Breakfast. So, explain to me why Internet access was an additional service that could cost you £75 (€85 / $120) a week, when in a Starbucks or McDonald’s it’s given away for free?
reviews.title: Not what it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Maybe the Marriott’s Internet service is ‘Superior’? No, it most certainly isn’t!
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used MR points for this trip and expected to be upgraded as a Platinum...did not get an upgrade, but the room was comfortable if not a bit small. (Frustarting to save your points up for a big trip and then not get an upgraded room..note to Marriott) It was also very clean. The executive lounge was nearly always full...oddly some people seemed to be there every time we went in...did they ever leave? :) I don't think it was a "full breakfast" or worthy of a dinner...unless you like tapas for dinner. The breakfast in the rest. was very good, cooked to order and reasonable if you're elite, but I think it was around 30 pounds if not...I can't imagine paying nearly $50 for breakfast!
reviews.title: Great location, superb staff...just not what I'd call 5 stars....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a boutique hotel feel, but I certainly have stayed in nicer Marriott properties and other 5 star hotels. This may be a 4 star hotel at best. What set this hotel apart was the staff...the bellmen, concierge, servers, cooks, and front desk staff were all efficient and very friendly. The location is also very good and the tour buses and cabs are just nearby.
reviews.title: Best Use of Marriott Reward Points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I also agree with other reviewers...its an insult to charge for wifi in the room...Marriott UK needs to get this right!
reviews.title: 5 star services and location but not a special hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights using my Marriott Reward points and I really felt we got the most for those points. The hotel is opposite "speaker corner" in Hyde Park at a very busy intersection teeming with people and vehicles. But once you walked through the door of the hotel it was an oasis of peace. We worried about the street noise but our hotel room was very quiet. Our room was well appointed with a comfortable king bed. The hotel is conveniently located right at the entrance to the Central line making it easy to get around especially in inclement weather. The hotel staff was very friendly and competent and the pool / fitness facilities outstanding. The central location made it a pleasant walk through Hyde Park to Buckingham Palace, Harrods, and Victoria and Albert Museum. This is a five star hotel with corresponding rates but if you can afford it or you have Marriott points to burn I would definitely recommend staying here while touring London
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to find being situated next to Marble Arch underground station. Five star service in every way from when you arrive in front of the hotel with the bell boys taking care of your luggage and untill you are in the room. My room was nice and with a finish that is suitable for a 5*. That said, it is not a special hotel in any way, but resembles many other hotels in the world - just with a bit more quality of service.
reviews.title: Convenient location, nice hotel, comfortable large bed with high quality bedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for New Year’s Eve. A quality hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfasts are very good – but remember to pre-order your fried eggs! Room was very good, spacious, clean and quiet. Only downside was the view of the wall opposite our window. The turndown service was also very good. Note: for the price they should include complimentary wifi. Also, steam room and swimming pool in basement very good. I would highly recommend this hotel for its central location to shops and attractions.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel with excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here with my wife for 4days, Checking in was a breeze the room was very well maintained with one chair and a desk, it was roomy compaired to most hotels in Europe. Just outside the hotel is a bus stop and at the other corner Marble Arch underground and around the corner is Oxford st. Excellent location for shopping and the staff are just out of this world, soo helpful & friendly. Though the only down turn for this hotel is it's a bit expensive & not much activities as they had limited facilities with only one restaurant.
reviews.title: Great hotel with wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Being from the U.S. Marriott is a very recognizable name-brand hotel so I felt good about staying there. It was a little pricey but that is to be expected when you are staying in London. I was so impressed upon arrival by the friendliness of the staff and the quality of the hotel. Our room was absolutely perfect for my family of three. We easily fit a roll-away for my daughter in the room and were still quite comfortable. The hotel restaurant had great food (I highly recommend the breakfast buffet and the steak dinner with the green beans!) and when we left the hotel I was thrilled we were right off of Oxford St. which has some great shopping! I felt so lucky we were able to stay here and it is now my absolute favorite hotel!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is located near the tunnel and speakers corner. The in- hotel restaurant is fantastic! There is a Italian food across the street and plenty of pubs in walking distance. Rooms were a little better than average for central London. Service was exceptional. Marriott rewards (gold or higher) members enjoy complimentary simple English breakfast everyday.
reviews.title: Great location and restaurant !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers!
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel

description: Stylish, luxury hotel with a boutique atmosphere, in former grand apartment building dating from 1919; set across from Hyde Park.
